name: 6-nitro-2-phenyl-3H-indol-3-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3395
Reason: 6-nitro-2-phenyl-3H-indol-3-one has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 3-indole, which has a melting point of around 106°C. The nitro group introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The phenyl group adds rigidity and molecular weight, contributing approximately +20°C. The indole ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and pi-pi interactions, estimated at around +20°C.
